channel.title: Blog on Rotational Labs
channel.description: Recent content in Blog on Rotational Labs

item.title: PubSub 101 - Creating a Subscriber
item.description: With the rise of LLMs and Retrieval Augmented Generation (RAG), online models have never been more relevant. Here’s how to write some Python code to interpret real-time data and build your own adaptive online model.

item.title: PubSub 101 - Creating a Publisher
item.description: One of the first steps in every data science or machine learning project is data ingestion. In this module, you will use Python to create a publisher to ingest real-time data into Ensign.

item.title: PubSub 101 - Creating Data Flows With Topics
item.description: If you struggle to build analytics and models that keep up with changing data, it might be because you haven’t yet learned to think about data in terms of topics. In this module, learn how by solving a real-world, real-time problem!

item.title: Building Real-Time Apps in Python with Ensign and Streamlit
item.description: Python may be the 2nd best language for everything, but it’s a favorite of data scientists worldwide, and delivers a world of functionality. Did you know you can even build customer-facing AI/ML apps with Python now? Learn how…

item.title: PubSub 101 - Using the PyEnsign SDK
item.description: The Python SDK is the most popular way to use Ensign. In this module you will write some Python code to publish data to your project.

item.title: PubSub 101 - Creating Your Project
item.description: Welcome to PubSub 101! In this module you will create a new Ensign account and a new project. After completing this module, you will have an API key that you can use to publish data to Ensign!

item.title: Reinforcement Learning, Automation... and Tetris
item.description: Every time I’m writing complex rules in my code, I remember there’s a machine learning technique for this: Reinforcement Learning. RL models are able to learn the optimal rules given predefined rewards. Read on to learn how!

item.title: Compression vs Cryptography: What Comes First?
item.description: Data encryption and compression are heavyweight algorithms that must be used with care in performance intensive applications; but when applying both mechanics to the same data, which should come first?

item.title: Welcome to Ensign U!
item.description: Like any new tool, Ensign takes a little time to learn. But take it from us (a bunch of seasoned data science experts) – it will open up a new world of data science applications for you. Check out this beginner-friendly introduction!

item.title: Spooky `asyncio` Errors and How to Fix Them
item.description: You’ve heard the asyncio library unlocks concurrency for Python with minimal syntactical overhead, but the terminology makes you tremble! Don’t panic â€” here are 3 of the most common errors you will encounter and how to fix them.

item.title: Rotational Announces Partnership, Hackathon with the University of Chicago Data Science Institute
item.description: Rotational Labs is excited to announce our partnership with the University of Chicago Data Science Institute, including co-hosting a hackathon to help students learn to apply real-time data science techniques to real-world problems.

item.title: How to Dockerize Python Data Science Processes
item.description: Docker is great, but most tutorials are geared toward devOps users, not data scientists. If you’re building long-running processes for NLP, ML, or generative AI, here’s a blueprint for Python Docker containers for data science!

item.title: My First Year as a Junior Developer at Rotational Labs
item.description: ðŸŽ‰ I just celebrated my first year as a junior developer. In this post, I’ll share some of the things I’ve learned and techniques I’ve grown to value over the last twelve months.

item.title: Intro to Polars: A Pandas Alternative for Efficiently Working with Large Datasets
item.description: Dataframes are a powerful data structure for data processing, analytics, and ML. For many years, Pandas has been my go-to. But it can really slow you down when you’re working with big or high-dimensional data. Enter Polars!

item.title: What is Incremental Machine Learning?
item.description: Most of us got into data science because it’s exciting (if chaotic) and there’s a constant stream of new ideas, which is thrilling (if intimidating). But if learning is all about keeping up, why can’t our models do it?

item.title: Using River and Vowpal Wabbit to Build Real-Time Machine Learning Models
item.description: Real-time ML models continually learn on new data as soon as it arrives, so they’re less susceptible to concept drift and data drift. Read on to learn how to use River and Vowpal Wabbit to build real-time models in Python.

item.title: Streaming NLP Analytics Made Easy With HuggingFace LLMs and Ensign
item.description: Thinking about using a large language model (LLM) at your organization? Check out this tutorial to see how to bootstrap an MVP using an open source pre-trained model from HuggingFace and a free Ensign account.

item.title: Speeding Up Go Tests
item.description: It can be frustrating as a developer to wait for a large test suite to run, particularly when you have to run the suite multiple times in development. In this post, we’ll explore parallel and short modes with Go tests in an effort to improve local test speed and save longer running tests for CI.

item.title: Building My First Event-Driven NLP Application
item.description: A few weeks ago, I’d never used an event stream before. Read on to hear how I built my first event-driven data science app â€” the biggest challenges, my lessons learned, and a couple of key takeaways!

item.title: MLOps 101: A Fresh Approach to Managing Models with Event Streams
item.description: If you can’t deploy your models, you might feel frustrated, but you aren’t alone â€” only 1 in 10 data science projects ever gets deployed. The fix? We need to shift our mental model towards “thinking in events.”
